sense.name: a spiral structure, having multiple loops
sense.examples: The double helix of DNA is two coils of protein that are intertwined. This mattress has coil springs.

sense.name: a single loop, a round shape, ringlet
sense.examples: The girl's hair was wrapped in a single coil at the back of her neck. The edges of the stationary were decorated with coils of ivy and flowers.

sense.name: an electrical device that conveys voltage or inductance in a circuit
sense.examples: Direct current flows through the primary coil of an inductance coil. The mechanic told him it was a problem with his ignition coil. This coil is a transformer with an air core that can produce high voltages at high frequencies.

sense.name: an intrauterine contraceptive
sense.commentary: COIL[+device][+spiral][+contraceptive][+intrauterine] Note: usually in the phrase 'the coil'
sense.examples: The woman had her coil removed from her uterus after five years. The coil has proven to be a very effective form of contraception.

sense.name: a roll of stamps
sense.examples: Mary bought two coils of stamps from the vending machine.

sense.name: a dried chemical burned to repel mosquitoes
sense.examples: The mosquito repellant coils our hotel gave us each evening only burned for about three hours. Sally didn't like the smell from the coil burning next to her bed.

sense.name: a quantity of rope or wire wound in circles
sense.examples: A coil of rope lay on the dock. There were coils of copper wire stacked up in the warehouse.

sense.name: an arrangement or series of connected pipes, tubes, wires
sense.examples: The homemade whisky still had an elaborate set of copper coils. Extensive coils extended around the walls of the biotech laboratory.
